intro: Boopis reichei, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sunlight. Boopis reichei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
